Superior salivatory nucleus.EditorialNote: Brodal has the SSN in the medulla (Fig. 11-2, pg 703);  Brain Info in the pontine tegmentum.  It looks to be at the pontomedullary junction, so I suppose that it's just where you'd like to put it, but needs review.
Superior salivatory nucleus.Definition: Nucleus containing parasympathetic neurons giving rise to the parasympathetic division of the facial nerve, innervating the salivary glands (Brodal, Neurological Anatomy, 3rd ed., 1981, pg 703).
